Make a list that's hopefully a bit more useful

```{r}
list_norm = 
  list(
    a = rnorm(20,0,5),
    b = rnorm(20,4,5),
    c = rnorm(20,0,10),
    d = rnorm(20,4,10)
  )


list_norm[["b"]]

```

Let's reuse the function we used last time

```{r}
mean_and_sd = function(x){
  mean_x = mean(x)
  sd_x = sd(x)
  
  out_df = 
    tibble(
      mean = mean_x,
      sd = sd_x
    )
  return(out_df)
}


mean_and_sd(list_norm[["a"]])
mean_and_sd(list_norm[["b"]])
mean_and_sd(list_norm[["c"]])
mean_and_sd(list_norm[["d"]])

```


## Use a for loop

Creat output list, and run a for loop

```{r}
output = vector("list", length = 4)

for (i in 1:4){
  output[[i]] = mean_and_sd(list_norm[[i]])
}

output
```


## Do the same thing

but with `map` instead


```{r}
map(list_norm, mean_and_sd)
```


```{r}
map(list_norm,mean)
map(list_norm,IQR)
```


```{r}
map_dfr(list_norm,IQR)
map_dbl(list_norm,IQR)
```
```{r}
map_dfr(list_norm,mean_and_sd)
```

### LIST COLUMNS!!!

```{r}
listcol_df = 
  tibble(
    name = c("a", "b", "c", "d"),
    samp = list_norm
  )

listcol_df

listcol_df |> 
  filter(name %in% c("a","b"))

listcol_df |> 
  select(-samp)

listcol_df[['samp']][["a"]]
```



```{r}
mean_and_sd(listcol_df[['samp']][["a"]])
```

```{r}
listcol_df[['samp']]
map(listcol_df[['samp']],mean_and_sd)
```
```{r}
df_new = 
  listcol_df |> 
  mutate(output = map(samp, mean_and_sd),
         iqr = map(samp, IQR),
         iqr_dbl = map_dbl(samp, IQR)) |> 
  select(-samp) |> 
  unnest(output)

df_new

```

```{r}
df_new = 
  listcol_df |> 
  mutate(output = map(samp, mean_and_sd),
         iqr = map(samp, IQR),
         iqr_dbl = map_dbl(samp, IQR)) |> 
  unnest(output)

df_new

```
